'Pages' was an American pop rock band of the late 1970s and early 1980s. The
band consisted of Richard Page and Steve George on vocals and keyboards,
supported by various studio musicians, some of whom from time to time were
considered part of the band proper. Although Pages was highly regarded for its
well-crafted pop and jazz-fusion sound, the group did not achieve commercial
success, and disbanded after recording three albums. Pages is perhaps best known
as the launching pad for the recording careers of Page and George, who later
formed Mr. Mister and topped the charts during the mid-1980s with pop classics
such as "Broken Wings" and "Kyrie."
categories: Musical groups from Los Angeles, California
